title: Rotational inertia - rod-sphere systems A B and C

content.question: The figure shows three systems, each consisting of a rod of negligible mass and one or two spheres attached to the rod. Each system can rotate about an axis that is perpendicular to the plane of the figure and located at the left end of the rod, and each sphereâ€™s mass is either <math alttext="uppercase M sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> or <math alttext="the fraction uppercase M sub 0, end sub, over 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math>, as indicated. If the rotational inertia of each sphere about its center of mass is negligible, which system, if any, has the greatest rotational inertia?

choices.label: All three systems have the same rotational inertia.

content.answer: All three systems have the same rotational inertia.
